nodes.description: 2016年3月25日，伊拉克巴比伦省阿斯里耶村足球比赛颁奖时发生自杀式爆炸
nodes.support_text: A suicide bomber blew himself up in a crowd after a local football game in the village of al-Asriya, near Iskandariya in the Babil Governorate, in a mixed Sunni-Shiite area on 25 March 2016. The bombing occurred as trophies were being presented after a football tournament. According to eyewitnesses, the bomber went through the crowd to approach the centre and blew himself up during the mayor's presentation of the awards.

nodes.description: 爆炸导致市长Ahmed Shaker死亡，其因伤后在医院不治身亡
nodes.support_text: The Mayor Ahmed Shaker was among those killed in the explosion; he succumbed to his wounds in a hospital.

nodes.description: 事件造成至少41人死亡、105人受伤，其中包含17名10-16岁儿童
nodes.support_text: The bombing killed at least 41 people and wounded more than 105. Many of the victims were young boys; according to an Iraqi official, at least 17 boys between the ages of 10 and 16 were killed.

nodes.description: 伊斯兰国宣称对袭击负责，指控目标为亲伊武装组织成员
nodes.support_text: The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant claimed responsibility for attack, claiming those targeted were members of the Popular Mobilization Forces.

nodes.description: 目击者称袭击者混入人群接近颁奖中心并引爆装置
nodes.support_text: According to eyewitnesses, the bomber went through the crowd to approach the centre and blew himself up during the mayor's presentation of the awards.

nodes.description: 巴比伦省宣布实施三天全国哀悼
nodes.support_text: Three days of mourning were declared in the Babil Governorate following the attack.

nodes.description: 联合国秘书长潘基文在访问期间谴责袭击
nodes.support_text: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon, who was visiting Iraq at the time, condemned the attack.

nodes.description: 国际足联与亚足联谴责利用体育场馆实施暴力行为
nodes.support_text: FIFA: Gianni Infantino, President of FIFA, said "it is a very sad day, when people, going to a match together, become the victims of such violence." Asian Football Confederation: AFC condemned the bombing by issuing a statement that said "Using football and sport stadiums as a stage for these heinous acts of violence is a cowardly, completely unjust and indiscriminate act."

edges.support_text: The Mayor Ahmed Shaker was among those killed in the explosion; he succumbed to his wounds in a hospital.
The bombing killed at least 41 people and wounded more than 105. Many of the victims were young boys; according to an Iraqi official, at least 17 boys between the ages of 10 and 16 were killed.
The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant claimed responsibility for attack, claiming those targeted were members of the Popular Mobilization Forces.
Three days of mourning were declared in the Babil Governorate following the attack.
Secretary General Ban Ki-moon, who was visiting Iraq at the time, condemned the attack.

FIFA: Gianni Infantino, President of FIFA, said "it is a very sad day, when people, going to a match together, become the victims of such violence." Asian Football Confederation: AFC condemned the bombing by issuing a statement that said "Using football and sport stadiums as a stage for these heinous acts of violence is a cowardly, completely unjust and indiscriminate act."
According to eyewitnesses, the bomber went through the crowd to approach the centre and blew himself up during the mayor's presentation of the awards.
